decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing a synergy of Human creatures to quickly build a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing Aether Vial to cheat mana costs and cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to disrupt the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to pave the way for powerful attacks from creatures like Mantis Rider and Champion of the Parish. With a focus on tempo and disruption, this deck seeks to capitalize on its aggressive creatures to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while maintaining control of the game through counter spells, removal, and card advantage. Using cards like Cryptic Command, Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, and Snapcaster Mage, the player can control the board state and dictate the pace of the game. The deck also utilizes versatile removal spells like Path to Exile, Lightning Helix, and Lightning Bolt to deal with threats efficiently. The manabase is carefully constructed to support the control strategy and ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana for spells.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent quickly and efficiently by playing aggressive threats like Tarmogoyf, Dark Confidant, and Bloodbraid Elf supported by disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells such as Fatal Push, Abrupt Decay, and Terminate to control the board and keep the pressure on the opponent. The planeswalkers Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope provide additional value and disruption, while cards like Kolaghan's Command and Lightning Bolt offer versatile answers to various threats. The deck aims to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on the aggressive play style of Eldrazi creatures, utilizing powerful Eldrazi Temple and mana-producing lands to quickly cast large threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and All Is Dust to control the opponent's board state. Additionally, the deck features utility cards like Karn Liberated and Wurmcoil Engine to provide further value and flexibility. Overall, the strategy of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient Eldrazi creatures while disrupting their game plan.

This UW Control deck focuses on maintaining control of the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It seeks to stabilize the board with Supreme Verdict and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, while using Search for Azcanta to filter through the deck. Snapcaster Mage allows for flexibility in reusing key spells, while Lightning Bolt and Lightning Helix provide additional removal and reach. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility, with a focus on accessing multiple colors of mana. The deck aims to outlast opponents and grind out victories through card advantage and powerful finishers.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive human tribal strategy. By utilizing cards like Noble Hierarch and Thalia's Lieutenant to boost the power of Champion of the Parish and other human creatures, along with disruptive elements like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to disrupt the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and maintain pressure throughout the game. Aether Vial allows for quick creature deployment and the deck's mana base is designed to support a consistent and efficient curve.

The main concept of this deck is to deal damage quickly and efficiently by playing low-cost, high-damage spells and creatures. By using burn spells like Shard Volley, Lava Spike, and Lightning Bolt, along with aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to rush down the opponent and win the game before they can stabilize. Cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Searing Blaze also punish the opponent for playing spells, adding pressure and increasing the likelihood of victory in a short amount of time.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost artifact creatures and boosting them with equipment like Cranial Plating to deal massive damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to swarm the battlefield with small threats like Ornithopter and Signal Pest, then use cards like Arcbound Ravager and Steel Overseer to enhance their power. The deck also has removal and card draw spells to maintain momentum and outpace the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy centered around artifact synergy.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays and disruption, utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Collective Brutality to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure with creatures like Bedlam Reveler, Young Pyromancer, and Lingering Souls. The deck also runs removal spells like Fatal Push, Lightning Bolt, and Dreadbore to deal with threats. Blood Moon is included to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck aims to efficiently control the board and quickly close out the game with its aggressive creatures.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly with elves to cast powerful spells like Collected Company and Chord of Calling to assemble game-winning combos. The main win condition is to flood the board with elves, pump them up with Ezuri, Renegade Leader, and then finish off the opponent with Shaman of the Pack's enter the battlefield ability. The deck also includes card draw and creature search options to maintain momentum and consistency in executing the combo. The lands are optimized to support the elf strategy by providing colored mana sources and additional benefits.

This deck focuses on playing creatures quickly to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression. By utilizing powerful Human creatures like Champion of the Parish, Mantis Rider, and Thalia's Lieutenant, the deck aims to build a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Kitesail Freebooter and Meddling Mage. With mana acceleration from Noble Hierarch and disruption from Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, the deck can quickly outpace the opponent and secure victory. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while the land base supports the tribal synergies of the deck.

This UR Control deck focuses on efficient removal, counterspells, and card advantage to control the game and win through incremental advantage. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's plans with counterspells and removal while generating card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Steam Vents. Blood Moon serves as a disruptive element against greedy mana bases, while cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Vendilion Clique provide additional card advantage and threats. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the game until it can secure a win condition.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Goblin Lore and Faithless Looting to bring out powerful creatures like Hollow One and Flamewake Phoenix. The Aggro strategy aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures while also disrupting their hand size and card selection with Burning Inquiry and Collective Brutality. The inclusion of cards like Street Wraith and Bloodghast allows for repeated recursion of creatures, keeping the pressure on the opponent. Tasigur, the Golden Fang and Gurmag Angler provide additional threats that can be brought out with cards already in the graveyard.

This Modern Jund Aggro deck focuses on disruption and efficiency, using powerful cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Liliana of the Veil to disrupt opponent's strategies while playing efficient threats like Tarmogoyf, Dark Confidant, and Bloodbraid Elf to close out the game quickly. The deck also has removal spells like Lightning Bolt, Fatal Push, and Abrupt Decay to handle opposing threats. By using a combination of disruption, efficient threats, and removal, this deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and outvalue them to secure a victory.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy utilizing efficient creatures and removal spells, while also leveraging the synergies between its creatures and land-based abilities. By ramping up early with mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise, the deck can quickly deploy threats such as Knight of the Reliquary and Courser of Kruphix. Collected Company allows the deck to generate card advantage and put multiple threats on the battlefield at once, while cards like Archangel Avacyn and Gavony Township provide additional ways to pump up its creatures and close out games quickly.

The deck focuses on maintaining control of the game through counter spells, removal, and card draw while using powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and card advantage engines like Search for Azcanta. The win condition is to out value the opponent and control the board until you can secure the game with a strong finisher like Celestial Colonnade or Secure the Wastes. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and slowly grind out a victory through card advantage and powerful control spells.
